intro: Tephrosia shamimii, commonly known as the Malabar tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Tephrosia shamimii also has potential ecological importance as a nitrogen fixer, contributing to soil fertility.
